Here are various kinds of books from famous writers which are of course interesting for you to read so hapy rading :) Dating and Relationship Advice for Men  Do you feel you are just missing out on the dating scene because you just don’t have it in you? Or are you just fed up with dating women you feel no connection with? Do you feel if you only could get some good advice on how to up your game, maybe you could end up dating more high-quality women? If yes, then you have come to the right place. There is no doubt that the dating scene has been getting tougher and tougher with every passing year. There are a lot of things you need to focus on to stay in the game. You need to look the part. You need to have top-notch communication and conversational skills. You also need to approach the woman the right way and say the right words. On top of it all, most of us don’t even know what women actually want! But don’t worry. This guide is here to help you out. There are definitely some tried and tested tips that will always work, whatever the year. If you have the right tools in your armor, the likelihood of getting the woman of your dreams and your future partner really does go higher. So, let’s get started and find out what skills you need to equip yourself with to get that girl you have been secretly admiring to go out with you.

"Art of Seduction" by Robert Greene dives into the psychology behind love/lust and the human desire for connection. Although some use this as a manual to seduce and lure people in, the book can give the reader insight to what people actually want in relationships. The author divides the book into different types of people, different types of seducers, etc. The book is honest and because it is right, it can be used to play mind games with others.  In order to have a successful relationship, I believe you must first understand what the other wants and needs. Then you must learn how to read the other person's unspoken signals. Of course, learning one's partner takes time and years. I think it would be wise to pick up this book and learn the potential needs and wants of the other. By the way, the "seduction" is not how to fulfill the partner in bed. It's about the seduction of the mind.
